properties.name: Baseball Field
properties.description: Posted by RyanhDad used to take me here for extra baseball practice.

properties.name: Belize Kayaking Trip
properties.description: Posted by RyanhDad, S, and I went on a kayaking expedition between the keyes in Belize. It was really cool. We kayaked between islands and camped out each night. On one of our last days, we paddled nearly 13 miles. I was in a single (hooray) and Dad and S were in a double (with a sail). They say the true test of a marriage is if you can paddle a double kayak together. Dad and S were tested. :-)

properties.name: Beverly Hills
properties.description: Posted by RyanhBeverly Hills, CADad grew up here and went to BHHS.

properties.name: Chapman House
properties.description: Posted by RyanhChapman HouseDad moved here after I went away to college. It was a pretty cool house, right above a lake.

properties.name: Corona Del Mar
properties.description: Posted by RyanhWe took a friend\'s small power-boat out into surprisingly choppy waters (for this area) and scattered the last of Dad\'s ashes here. He was science teacher and oceanographer at heart and would have wanted to be close to home. Later, while training for a triathlon, I would swim out there and feel that I had some extra help.

properties.name: England Trip
properties.description: Posted by RyanhLondon, EnglandThis was my first big trip out side of the U.S. Once we arrived and drove out to a small countryside town, Dad thought it would be a good idea to walk to dinner -- a place he said he saw on the drive in. We ended up walking about 5 miles - in the dark - through muddy fields, to end up at a pub where we had fish n\' chips.

properties.name: Glover's Reef (Belize)
properties.description: Posted by RyanhWe had this trip planned before Dad passed away and almost canceled it. This would have been the second trip to Glover\'s for him. This was the first place we scattered any of his remains, and we went to the far end of the small island, waded a few yards from shore, and somewhat uncerimoniously, dumped the contents of the bag into the water. Later, we saw one of the "natives" fly fishing on that point -- I\'m sure Dad was helping him.

properties.name: Goodbye
properties.description: Posted by Ryanh10912 Paddock Lane, Santa Ana, CAThis was the last time I saw him. It was G\'s 60th birthday party. My Dad was out back BBQing for all 60+ people there, getting grease on his glasses. It didn\'t seem significant at the time, but I look back on that party, and the pictures I have of it, and am reminded about what a great guy he was.

properties.name: Guatemala Trip
properties.description: Posted by RyanhWhen I was 12, my Dad and S thought it would be "fun" to go to Guatemala.

properties.name: Half-Day Fishing Trips
properties.description: Posted by RyanhÂ Balboa Island, CAWe\'d leave from Balboa to go on half-day fishing trips. We did this more when I was a kid. Later, after I was away at college, I think, I asked if we could do it again. I remember driving to the docks with him ass-early. A gnarly, old (early 40s) waitress in the diner flirted with him (at 5am). lol...

properties.name: Heritage Park
properties.description: Posted by Ryanhirvine, caThere\'s a large slide here - about 70-100 feet, I\'d guess. I\'m told (b/c I don\'t remember) that when I was a baby (about 2 I think), my Dad and S took me to this park and we were playing on the slide. Apparently, I started going down the slide and started to topple over. My Dad dove down the slide headfirst and caught me before I fell. It sounds pretty dramatic, and that\'s my Dad-as-Action-Hero moment. :)

properties.name: Home in Coto de Caza
properties.description: Posted by Ryanh3 Summerside, Coto de Caza, CAMy Dad\'s last house.

properties.name: La Fondue
properties.description: Posted by Ryanh14510 Big Basin Wy Saratoga, CA 95070Took Dad and S here for his 57th birthday. They came up to visit for a weekend and we showed them around our new home in SJ. This was really the first time that he saw me out on my own and totally independent. A very memorable weekend. He died 3 weeks later...

properties.name: March 5th, 2003
properties.description: Posted by RyanhThis is where he died...

properties.name: New Orleans
properties.description: Posted by RyanhNew Orleans, LANew Orleans was one of my Dad and S\'s favorite travel locations, esp. in the U.S. We scattered some of his ashes in the Mississippi with friends and enjoyed the French Quarter weekend.

properties.name: Northwood High
properties.description: Posted by Ryanhirvine, caDad last worked at Northwood High in Irvine where he was a football coach and science teacher. When he died, the school put on a wonderful memorial service for him. http://www.irvineworldnews.com/Astories/mar13/huff.html The kids (Freshman) he coached later went on to get 2nd place in the CIF finals in 2005, and dedicated the season to him.

properties.name: Our Wedding
properties.description: Posted by Ryanh1500 Ralston Ave, Belmont, 94002We were married at Ralston Hall in October of 2002. On the day of the wedding, I did a nice job shaving the skin off my neck and didn\'t realize until I got to the Hall that I was bleeding all over my collar. My dad - the science teacher - ran out to a nearby drugstore and got some hydrogen peroxide. It took it right out!

properties.name: Santa Clara Home
properties.description: Posted by Ryanh18152 Santa Clara, Santa Ana CAThis was the house that my Dad and S had while I was growing up.

properties.name: Thailand Trip
properties.description: Posted by RyanhAs a graduation present, Dad and S said they would take me on a trip to anywhere I wanted. S suggested Thailand, and I thought, "Why not?" This was the first (and only) trip that we went on after I had "grown up." It was a fantastic trip and we did so much. I recall Dad saying "You\'re really fun to travel with!" (somewhat surprised because our last big trip that we did as a family was Guatemala - emphasis on "mal")

properties.name: The Bahamas & Haleys Comet
properties.description: Posted by RyanhI think it was 1987... Dad, S, and I went with several of their friends to Nassau in the Bahamas. Not many 10-year olds can say that. While there we saw Haleys Comet on its 76-year-cycle. I\'m not sure if that was the reason for the trip, but Dad made sure that it was the highlight of the trip - for me and everyone else. I remember that he woke us all up at 3am. I don\'t think half of us knew what was going on. But with his contagious excitement, he managed to get everyone up and in front of the hotel. But the view wasn\'t *quite* good enough for Dad, so he started jogging down the street. When we realized he wasn\'t just heading across the street, we all started running after him. I think we probably ran a half-mile before we reached a clearing where we could see the comet. I can still visuallize it: a bright, fuzzy star with a faint, wispy tail behind it. It was fantastic, and probably the best reason to wake up at 3am as I\'ve ever found.

properties.name: The Caplan's
properties.description: Posted by RyanhÂ My cousins\' house was here at K39 in Baja. We spent many weekends out here when I was a kid. In the last 10 years or so, they kicked everyone out and bulldozed everything.

properties.name: Warner Springs
properties.description: Posted by RyanhWarner Springs, CAToo many memories... :)
